column2: What is the article's page numbers in the conference paper?
column4: Who are the authors? (Last name only)
column5: Which year is the article from? (Conference publication year)
column6: Is the article about classification (n/reasoning or y/quote)
column7: Which part of body or disease is the article about? (own words)
column8: What is the aim/task of the article? (quote)
column9: What is the justification for this task? (quote)
column10: How many citations does the article have?
column11: When are the citations from? (range, oldest to newest)
column13: Which method is used for classification? (quote)
column15: Does the article use segmentation as preprocessing? (n/reasoning or y/quote)
column16: Does the used dataset have a title? (n/reasoning or y/quote)
column17: What is the size of the dataset (input quote)
column18: What type is the dataset, public, private, other? (quote/reasoning)
column19: Is the survey/method of how the dataset was obtained accessible? (no/reasoning or y/quote)
column20: Does the dataset have any mention of demographics of patients/images included? (n/reasoning or y/quote)
column21: Does the article mention the intent for collecting the dataset, the task intended? (n/reasoning or y/quote)
column22: Does the article disclose any affiliations? (n/reasoning or y/quote)
column23: (Menlo ethics 1/4) Does the article include anything about respect for persons (informed consent, voluntary participation) participating in the dataset? (n/reasoning or y/quote)
column24: (Menlo ethics 2/4) Does the article have any mention of benefience, minimising risk/maximising benefit of work? (n/reasoning or y/quote)
column25: (Menlo ethics 3/4) Does the article have any mention of justice (equal treatment, fair selection of subjects)? (n/reasoning or y/quote)
column26: (Menlo ethics 4/4) Does the article mention any respect for law/public interest (transparency in methods/results, accountability for actions)? (n/reasoning or y/quote)
column27: Are there any other comments/interesting aspects?

column3: Surgical Gesture Classification from Video Data
column6: y/"we propose and evaluate three approaches to surgical gesture classification from video."
column8: What is the aim/task of the article? (quote)
column9: "Most of the prior work on surgical gesture recognition (see, e.g., [4-6]) uses hidden Markov models (HMMs) to analyze kinematic data stored by the robot (…) Overall, our main conclusion is that methods based on video data perform equally well as methods based n kinematic data for a typical surgical training setup."
column13: "In the first one, we model each video clip from each surgical gesture as the output of a linear dynamical system (LDS) and use metrics in the space of LDSs to classify new video clips. In the second one, we use spatio-temporal features extracted from each video clip to learn a dictionary of spatio-temporal words and use a bag-of-features (BoF) approach to classify new video clips. In the third approach, we use multiple kernel learning to combine the LDS and BoF approaches."
column14: "The performance is measured as the percentage of correctly identified surgemes averaged over all tests and repetitions for each setup"
column15: n/There is no mention of segmentation, but the article does write: "We assume that each video is segmented into video surgemes", so the segmentation has been done prior to the work in this article. Later they write: "the data was manually segmented based on the surgeme's definition of [3]."
column16: y/"For our tests we used the California dataset [3]."
column17: "The dataset consists of three different tasks: suturing (SU, 39 trials), needle passing (NP, 26 trials) and knot tying (KT, 36 trials). Each task is performed by 8 surgeons with different skill levels."
column18: Private/There is no mention of a public dataset, and the article writes "The authors thank Intuitive Surgical and Carol Reiley for providing the dataset"
column19: n/Upon searching for the dataset nothing has been found, other than the article referenced
column20: n/no mention of demographics, though the article does specify that "Each task is performed by 8 surgeons with different skill levels"
column21: n/the article contains no mention of intent of data collection
column22: y/"This work was funded by NSF grants 0931805 and 0941362, and by the Talentia Fellowships Programme of the Andalusian Regional Ministry of Economy, Innovation and Science"
column23: n/ the article contains no information about the surgeons in the dataset or the patients they were presumably operating on
column24: n/the focus of the article is to promote a new method, mode of analysis, and does not mention any risk or benefit other than the usefulness of this new method
column25: n/there is no mention of this
column26: n/the article has no mention of this
